page.title: 04CATMERE END & NUNN'S FARM
page.content: Catmere End was built in the 17th centuary because during the plague in 1665 people fled from other villages to Catmere End.The oldest houses are 300 years old,the newest are ten years old. Catmere End has seen many changes over the years.The hedgerows have been cut down,woodland cleared,shops closed down and the bus service has been stopped.The main land cover is arable crops and there is also a lot of woodland.There are no amenities. The farmhouse is 200-300 years old.The farming is arable,the main crops are wheat & barley.The soil is chalk & clay.The farmer has only one worker.He has 3 tractors & one combine harvester,he also has grain storage for 800 tonnes.Other features include the disused chalk pit which has been filled in.
